result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
10:26 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Kevin M Coffen in court, in custody.  Attorney Kirk Andrew Redetzke in court for Kevin M Coffen.  Prosecuting attorney Christian Farina in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Redetzke provides an update; he has discovery but is waiting on an offer.  Atty. Redetzke is requesting a new further proceedings date after 11/16/22, also noting he will be filing a motion to modify bail as well.   No objection by the State. Court adjourns for hearing only.
Hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt:
Request for Substitution against Judge Bohren, received on today's date. Filed by Atty Redetzke.

**Reviewed by Judge Bohren on October 12, 2022 - APPROVED.**
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

9:38 AM Defendant Kevin M Coffen in court.  Attorney Kirk Andrew Redetzke in court for Kevin M Coffen.  Prosecuting attorney Mary Caitlin Brejcha in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary. 
Waive reading of Information. 
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.

8:15 AM Defendant Kevin M Coffen in court, in custody.  Attorney Kirk Andrew Redetzke in court for Kevin M Coffen.  Attorney Jack A. Pitzo in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Redetzke requests an adjournment to have more time to speak to the defendant in regards to the preliminary hearing.  Attorney Redetzke anticipates a waiver and notes the defendant is currently on a probation hold.  Defense waives the time limits associated with the preliminary hearing and requests a status date.  Attorney Redetzke will notify the Court and the State if this matter should be set for a preliminary hearing.  Court sets a status hearing next week.  Bail remains as fixed.
Hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 09:15 am.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key, signed by Judge Michael O. Bohren on September 26, 2022.
Preliminary hearing on October 5, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Status conference on October 4, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to use/possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.  Defendant to have no contact with Victims listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant ordered to CAM monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services until further order of the Court. 
  Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM monitoring.  Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release.

3:31 PM Defendant Kevin M Coffen in court, in custody.  Attorney Cassandra A Miller Ms. in court for Kevin M Coffen.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder. 
 Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 10 DAYS.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Status conference scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
